content:
I really like how slack does this. Let's say you have a section like this:
pasted image

If you change any setting, a "Saving" then "Saved" animation plays to the right of the title (in this case, to the right of Sound & appearance). The animation ensures people see it, and then you can get rid of it. Also means no strings have to be written other than the text for the setting.

Yeah, that seems like a fine approach. One thing to keep in mind is that we have a few settings that require reloading the browser after changes (because they're rarely changed); we should make sure we still have a way to express that idea. And for admin settings where we want someone to click "save", we could use the space to show "Unsaved changed" in red, so the user knows we're not auto-saving in that widget.

@Brock Whittaker FYI since we've been talking about cleaning up the alerts system.
I would like to work on this issue.. Can I?
@Rishi Gupta @Tim Abbott
I would look for issues in the issue tracker. This is also a tricky design question.
